fr.xephi.authme.api.v3

Class AuthMeApi

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.xephi.authme.api.v3.AuthMeApi

  • public class AuthMeApi
extends Object
    The current API of AuthMe. Recommended method of retrieving the AuthMeApi object: AuthMeApi authmeApi = AuthMeApi.getInstance();

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static AuthMeApi getInstance()
        Get the AuthMeApi object for AuthMe.
        Returns:
        The AuthMeApi object, or null if the AuthMe plugin is not enabled or not fully initialized yet

      • getPlugin

        public AuthMe getPlugin()
        Return the plugin instance.
        Returns:
        The AuthMe instance

      • getPluginVersion

        public String getPluginVersion()
        Gather the version number of the plugin. This can be used to determine whether certain AuthMeApi features are available or not.
        Returns:
        Plugin version identifier as a string.

      • isAuthenticated

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • isUnrestricted

        public boolean isUnrestricted(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Check whether the given player is unrestricted. For such players, AuthMe will not require them to authenticate.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to verify
        Returns:
        true if the player is unrestricted
        See Also:
        RestrictionSettings.UNRESTRICTED_NAMES

        @Deprecated
public Date getLastLogin(String playerName)
        Deprecated. Use Java 8's Instant method getLastLoginTime(String)
        Get the last (AuthMe) login date of a player.
        Parameters:
        playerName - The name of the player to process
        Returns:
        The date of the last login, or null if the player doesn't exist or has never logged in

      • getLastLoginTime

        Get the last (AuthMe) login timestamp of a player.
        Parameters:
        playerName - The name of the player to process
        Returns:
